tool.name: MzMLSplitter
tool.description: Splits an mzML file into multiple parts
tool.command:
MzMLSplitter
#if $param_in: -in $param_in #end if #if $param_out: -out "$param_out" #end if #if $param_parts: -parts $param_parts #end if #if $param_size: -size $param_size #end if #if $param_unit: -unit #if " " in str($param_unit): "$param_unit" #else $param_unit #end if #end if #if $param_no_chrom: -no_chrom #if " " in str($param_no_chrom): "$param_no_chrom" #else $param_no_chrom #end if #end if #if $param_no_spec: -no_spec #if " " in str($param_no_spec): "$param_no_spec" #else $param_no_spec #end if #end if #if $adv_opts.adv_opts_selector=='advanced': #if $adv_opts.param_force: -force #if " " in str($adv_opts.param_force): "$adv_opts.param_force" #else $adv_opts.param_force #end if #end if #end if > $param_stdout

param.name: param_out
param.label: Prefix for output files ('_part1of2.mzML' etc
param.help: (-out) will be appended; default: same as 'in' without the file extension)

param.name: param_parts
param.label: Number of parts to split into (takes precedence over 'size' if set)

param.name: param_size
param.label: Approximate upper limit for resulting file sizes (in 'unit')

tool.help:
Splits an mzML file into multiple parts
For more information, visit http://ftp.mi.fu-berlin.de/OpenMS/release-documentation/html/UTILS_MzMLSplitter.html
